title: Beware of ‘No Down Payment’ Loan Scams in Kuwait
description: KUWAIT CITY, Nov 30: Kuwait’s Central Bank and banking authorities have issued a strong warning to the public about the growing circulation of fraudulent advertisements on social media platforms. These ads often lure individuals with phrases such as “quick loan” or “no down payment,” targeting those...

title: S&P raises Kuwait’s sovereign credit rating to AA- with stable outlook
description:
KUWAIT CITY, Nov 22: Standard & Poor’s (S&P) Global Ratings raised Kuwait’s sovereign credit rating from A+ to AA- on Friday while maintaining a stable outlook, citing progress in public finance reforms, the Central Bank of Kuwait announced.

In a statement to Kuwait News Agency (KUNA), the Central ...

title: Gulf homes are 'creativity platforms' for promising projects: Kuwait minister

title: GCC moves closer to forming unified civil aviation authority, says Kuwait official
description:
The Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) is moving towards establishing a unified civil aviation authority following a recommendation by the GCC Executive Committee for Civil Aviation, according to Sheikh Humoud Mubarak Al-Sabah, Chief of Kuwait’s Directorate General of Civil Aviation.

title: Key economic figures define Kuwait’s 2025–2026 outlook
description: Six essential figures define the Kuwaiti economy and shape our economic situation, thereby explaining our 2025–2026 budget. title: New Digital Commerce Law Set to Transform Kuwait’s Online Economy
description: KUWAIT CITY, Nov 18: The Kuwaiti Cabinet convened its weekly meeting on Tuesday morning at Bayan Palace, chaired by His Highness the Prime Minister Sheikh Ahmed Al-Abdullah. title: Kuwait doubles residency fees, introduces 15-year golden visa
description:
Kuwait’s immigration system overhaul represent one of the most extensive revisions to the country’s residency framework in years, affecting hundreds of thousands of expatriates who comprise the majority of the Gulf nation's workforce.

title: Gold prices surge to $4,218 an ounce on US interest rate cut hopes
description:
KUWAIT CITY, Nov 30: Gold prices rose to USD 4,218 per ounce at the close of last week’s trading, supported by expectations that the US Federal Reserve will cut interest rates in December, according to a report issued Sunday by Kuwaiti company Dar Al-Sabaik.

title: PM outlines Vietnam’s development vision, strategic ties with Kuwait in policy address
